TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListItemStructure extends System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.SemanticBasicElement implements class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.BlockElement>, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Docs.summary: Represents an item in a list or outline.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> can only be a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.BlockElement element) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a block to a list item.
Gets or sets the name of the numeral, character, or bullet symbol for the list item as it appears in the formatting markup of the document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure> mirrors a set of items, usually short paragraphs, that are actually formatted as a list in the `<FixedPage>` part of a document's markup. Typically, each item in the list is formatted with a marker such as a numeral, character, or bullet. The marker could also be multiple characters or even an image. The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure.Marker%2A> property is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> attribute of the element, in the `<FixedPage>` part of a document's markup, that specifies what that marker is. For example, if the marker element specifies the numeral 3 as the marker for a list item and the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> of that element is 'ThirdItem', then the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure.Marker%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> that mirrors the list item should be set to 'ThirdItem.'
If a list item has a marker, failing to reference the marker with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure.Marker%2A> property of the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> may force applications that are consuming the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> to display or print the marker at the end of the document.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddChild(object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Adds a child object to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure>.
Typically, a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> is a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ParagraphStructure>, but it can be a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.FigureStructure>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.TableStructure>, or a (nested) <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure>.

Docs.exception: is not one of the types that can be a child of this class. See **Remarks**.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddText(string text) cil managed
